title: Denoising Diffusion Models

definitions.Gaussian noise: In the forward diffusion process, the small Gaussian noise is incrementally added to the distribution over T steps, resulting in a series of increasingly noisy samples.

formulas: q(x_t|x_t-1) = N(x_t; sqrt(1 - beta_t * x_t-1), beta_t * I)
summary: The slide discusses Denoising Diffusion Models, focusing on the forward diffusion process where Gaussian noise is incrementally added to a distribution over T steps, resulting in increasingly noisy samples. A formula is provided to represent this process.
